items.description:
Harrow Talking Newspaper for the blind (HTN) is a voluntary organisation and registered charity that produces  weekly news audio-recordings for visually impaired  local people. News recordings, based on local newspapers, are produced on Wednesday evenings, reaching the listeners by free post within the next couple of days.

The recordings are issued on memory sticks which enable us to add internet and BBC podcasts of special interest to visually impaired residents. Listeners are supplied with an easy-to-use  digital player.

This opportunity has been posted by Voluntary Action Harrow Co-operative, on behalf of the Harrow Talking Newspaper.
items.title: Editor/Presenter Of Audio News Recordings

items.description:
Harrow Talking Newspaper for the blind (HTN) is a voluntary organisation and registered charity that produces  weekly news audio-recordings for visually impaired  local people. News recordings, based on local newspapers, are produced on Wednesday evenings, reaching the listeners by free post within the next couple of days.

The recordings are issued on memory sticks which enable us to add internet and BBC podcasts of special interest to visually impaired residents. Listeners are supplied with an easy-to-use  digital player.

The recordings are made on Wednesday evenings from 7pm to 9.30pm Each volunteer works an evening once a month or on a rota, so the dates are flexible. 

This opportunity has been posted by Voluntary Action Harrow Co-operative, on behalf of the Harrow Talking Newspaper.
items.title: Sound Recordist

items.description:
Come help maintain the gardens, spending  2-3 hours weeding, and some digging sometimes, with a coffee/tea break with free tea/coffee and home-made cakes.

This opportunity has been posted by Voluntary Action Harrow Co-operative, on behalf of the Friends of the Harrow Museum.
items.title: Museum Garden Helper

items.description:
By Volunteering to work with beavers, you will be responsible, along with the other leaders, helpers and members for planning and running the weekly activities for 6-8 year olds! 

It is a fun and rewarding role, allowing you to watch the young people enjoy the activities you organise, as well as being involved in their development as they grow in confidence and ability. 

The Scout Association provides a wide range of books and electronic resources to aid volunteers plan their activities together with an award winning training scheme and on-line programme resources.

items.description:
We need a volunteer to help us run our Explorer Unit. You would be responsible, along with the other leaders, helpers and members for planning and leading the weekly activities for 14- 18 year olds! And don't worry if you cant make it every week.
We particularly need someone who can help us with our administration. Things like keeping on top of who has gained awards, or who owes membership fees.

It is a fun and rewarding role, allowing you to watch the young people develop their confidence and
ability whilst they enjoy the activities you organise. Leaders are responsible, with Assistant Leaders, helpers and members, for supporting the young people with planning and running the weekly activities. 

The Scout Association provides a wide range of books and electronic resources to aid volunteers plan their activities.

for_recruiter.name: Scouts - Scout Association - Greater London Region

owner_recruiter.name: Scouts - Scout Association - Greater London Region

items.title: Leaders (to support 14-18 year old Explorer Scouts)Pegasus

items.description:
Purpose of Role: 
Acting as a supporter to parents of children with special educational needs. Our aim is to help tackle the sense of social isolation felt by many parents of a child with special needs, so your role would be to a crucial one - buddy, confidante, moral supporter - to name but a few.  This could include covering our helpline, getting involved with organising our support group or simply meeting up with parents for a coffee and a chat.

Responsibilities / Role Description: 
- Working with families and understanding their perspective.
- Assisting parents to professional meeting.
- Supporting IAS caseworker with families.
- Working constructively with professionals.
- Helping to fill various paperwork.
- School visits with parents (e.g. Helping parents understand the process  to choose school).
- Working with young people and understanding their perspective.
- To ensure you have an understanding (appropriate to your role) of Independent supporter, and comply with Family Action’s procedures for promoting and safeguarding the welfare of children and vulnerable adults.
- To comply with Family Action’s Diversity & Equality Policy and our Ethical Policy in every aspect of your work and positively promote the principles of these policies  amongst colleagues, service users, volunteers and other members of the community.
- To comply with Family Action’s Health and Safety Policy, Data Protection Policy and to protect your own and others’ health, safety and welfare.

This opportunity has been posted by Voluntary Action Harrow Co-operative, on behalf of the Harrow SENDIAS.
items.title: Harrow Information, Advise and Support Volunteer (2-4 Hours A Week)

items.description:
•	Answering, screening and forwarding phone calls. 

•	Giving basic advice relating to special educational needs and disability (for which training will be given)

•	Managing diaries

•	Compassionately approaching sensitive case-details
 
•	Good literacy skills

•	Able to deal with difficult clients or customers (for which support and training will be provided)

•	Data entry
items.title: Admin Support Worker
